triples.name: Game theory
triples.relevance: The paper builds upon existing game theory to explain systematic deviations in human behavior from game-theoretic predictions.

triples.name: Nash equilibrium
triples.relevance: The paper addresses convergence to game-theoretic equilibrium after learning experiences, using Nash equilibrium as a reference point.

triples.name: Cooperative game theory
triples.relevance: The paper discusses cooperation as a systematic deviation from self-interest, central to understanding behavioral game theory.

triples.name: Economic fairness
triples.relevance: The paper identifies fairness as a key motivation for deviations from purely self-interested behavior in game-theoretic settings.

triples.name: Behavioral game theory
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a behavioral game theory framework that explains initial deviations and their disappearance through learning.
